text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Leeston | settlement_type = Town |image_skyline = Leeston War Memorial and Main Street.JPG |map_caption = Location of Leeston |image_map = |pushpin_map = |coordinates = |subdivision_type=Country |subdivision_name=New Zealand |subdivision_type1=Island |subdivision_type2= Region |subdivision_type3= Territorial authority |subdivision_type4 = Ward |subdivision_name1=South Island |subdivision_name2= Canterbury |subdivision_name3= Selwyn District |subdivision_name4 = Ellesmere |area_total_km2= 2.44 |population_total= |population_as_of= |population_footnotes= |population_density_km2= auto |postal_code_type= Postcode(s) |postal_code= 7632 |timezone= NZST |utc_offset= +12 |timezone_DST= NZDT |utc_offset_DST= +13 |blank_name = Local iwi |blank_info = Ngāi Tahu }} Leeston (Māori: Karumata) is a town in the Selwyn District, New Zealand. It is situated 30 kilometers southwest of Christchurch. It has a primary school and high school. It has three camping grounds located on the Selwyn River and opened its first art gallery in 2017. ==References== Category:Towns in Canterbury Region Category:Selwyn District
title: Leeston
